sentence.idiomatic: It is very quiet inside the office.
It is really quiet here. Not even a sound can be heard.
Why are you all so noisy? Can you quiet down a bit?
Drinking a lot of coffee will make it not easy to go to sleep.
If you go to bed too late it can cause you to get wrinkles.
If you eat too much of this you can easily get a stomachache.
It is so stuffy in here. I want to go outside and get some air.
You do not want to blow the air conditioning towards children.
You can use a hair dryer to blow dry your hair.
Yesterday I committed a serious mistake.
This question is not very serious. It is easy to solve.
Is her sickness serious?
You cannot carelessly take medicine. Mishandling can make your illness even worse.
Don't leave things scattered about. To place things unwisely can lead you to break them.
Now there is a congestion of cars. If not handled properly it will stay jammed.
How is it possible that you don't know him?
How is it possible the computer broke on its own?
He loves you very much. How is it possible he hit you?
I am not kidding you.
Adults should not deceive children.
Why did you fool me again? I wont believe you the next time.
A-Bao, you can't drink ice water.
But Grandma, I'm so hot.
Still not OK. Be still and you won't be hot.
Then can I eat some ice cream?
Certainly not. You'll get diarrhea. Besides, eating cold things makes you more likely to catch a cold.
Fine, I won't eat it.
A-Bao, how can you sit in front of the air conditioner? You can't let the air conditioner blow directly on you. It'll make you sick.
Grandma, no it won't.
What do little kids know? Sitting in front of the air conditioner is the surest way to catch a cold. Even more serious than eating frozen things.
Grandma, what does a cold matter? It's just a minor illness, not like a fever or anything.
Minor illness? Colds are serious, and if you don't deal with them right you could die.
You could really die?
Would Grandma lie to you? When I was little I saw someone die of a cold. So you have to listen to me, don't eat frozen things, and don't sit in front of the air conditioner.
Oh, I got it.
